content.description: Fun TR arete climb between Schoolroom and Not for Teacher.  Interesting moves and hard to find crimpers make this a worthwhile climb that stays challenging all the way up.
content.location: Schoolroom cracks - arete between Not for Teacher and Schoolroom routes

content.description: A great moderate climb to hop on after your warm up on Dunce.
content.location: Find the climbers bench. Sit down. Look up.

content.description: A pretty good moderate to hop on if Smokin' is occupied.
content.location: Just to the right of Dunce.  Uses the middle anchor at the top of the lower columns.

content.description: this very dirty climb follows a flared crack up the right side of schoolroom cracks. there is a directional bolt to allow top roping this route from the shared Smokin' anchors, which makes this a marginally fun climb. Leading this would seem dubious with all that moss...
content.protection: book says pro to 2" but I would stick to leading smokin' and use this as a TR only
content.location: to the right of Smokin'. follows angled crack up to Smokin' anchors

content.description: This is a pretty committing climb for the grade. There are holds, the moves are there, but it might not be so straight forward. Lots of great small edges, and some good smearing/stemming opportunities for the taller folk. Great lead if you're feeling up to the challenge, or a wonderful TR if someone were to lead Dunce or Schoolroom.
content.protection: Gear to 2", the gear is sparce in places, but you can protect rather safely.

content.description: A great warm up climb for those looking for a moderate day at Pete's.
content.location: The wider, easier looking crack on the far left of the shorter columns.  It uses the left most visible anchor from the bench.

content.description: The crux is a roof/ceiling that is shaped like a bottle cap (hence the name). Climb right of the ceiling to the face and then 40 feet to the top-chains. First 30 feet are tough to protect, but scaling the roof is well worth the climb.
content.protection: Standard rack - Lots of opportunity for nuts.
content.location: The closest climb to the Playground.

content.description: Middle group of climbs at Pete's. Cool bench to belay from and a brush to help keep the routes clean.
